verses.verse: And the Philistines<WH6430> took<WH3947> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430>, and brought<WH935> it from Eben<WH72>â€“ezer unto Ashdod<WH795>.
When the Philistines<WH6430> took<WH3947> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430>, they brought<WH935> it into the house<WH1004> of Dagon<WH1712>, and set<WH3322> it by<WH681> Dagon<WH1712>.

And when they of Ashdod<WH796> arose early<WH7925> on the next day<WH4283>, behold<WH1712>, Dagon was fallen<WH5307> upon his face<WH6440> to the earth<WH776> before<WH6440> the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>. And they took<WH3947> Dagon<WH1712>, and set<WH7725> him in his place<WH4725> again<WH7725>.

And when they arose early<WH7925> on the next day<WH4283> morning<WH1242>, behold<WH1712>, Dagon was fallen<WH5307> upon his face<WH6440> to the ground<WH776> before<WH6440> the ark<WH727> of the Lord<WH3068>; and the head<WH7218> of Dagon<WH1712> and both<WH8147> the palms<WH3709> of his hands<WH3027> were cut off<WH3772> upon the threshold<WH4670>; only the stump of Dagon<WH1712> was left to him<WH7604>.

Therefore neither the priests<WH3548> of Dagon<WH1712>, nor any that come<WH935> into Dagon<WH1712>'s house<WH1004>, tread<WH1869> on the threshold<WH4670> of Dagon<WH1712> in Ashdod<WH795> unto this day<WH3117>.

But the hand<WH3027> of the Lord<WH3068> was heavy<WH3513> upon them of Ashdod<WH796>, and he destroyed<WH8074> them<WH5221>, and struck them with ulcers<WH2914>, even Ashdod<WH795> and the coasts there<WH1366>.

And when the men<WH582> of Ashdod<WH795> saw<WH7200> that it was so<WH559>, they said, The ark<WH727> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> shall not stay<WH3427> with us<WH3027>: for his hand is severe<WH7185> upon us<WH1712>, and upon Dagon our god<WH430>.

They sent<WH7971> therefore and gathered<WH622> all the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430> unto them<WH559>, and said, What shall we do<WH6213> with the ark<WH727> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>? And they answered<WH559>, Let the ark<WH727> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> be carried about<WH5437> unto Gath<WH1661>. And they carried<WH5437> the ark<WH727> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> about there<WH5437>.

And it was so<WH310>, that, after they had carried it about<WH5437>, the hand<WH3027> of the Lord<WH3068> was against the city<WH5892> with a very<WH3966> great<WH1419> destruction<WH4103>: and he struck<WH5221> the men<WH582> of the city<WH5892>, both small<WH6996> and great<WH1419>, and they had ulcers<WH2914> in their secret parts<WH8368>.

Therefore they sent<WH7971> the ark<WH727> of God<WH430> to Ekron<WH6138>. And it came to pass<WH727>, as the ark of God<WH430> came<WH935> to Ekron<WH6138>, that the Ekronites<WH6139> cried out<WH2199>, saying<WH559>, They have brought about<WH5437> the ark<WH727> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478> to us<WH4191>, to kill us and our people<WH5971>.

So they sent<WH7971> and gathered together<WH622> all the lords<WH5633> of the Philistines<WH6430>, and said<WH559>, Send away<WH7971> the ark<WH727> of the God<WH430> of Israel<WH3478>, and let it go again<WH7725> to his own place<WH4725>, that it kill<WH4191> us not<WH5971>, and our people: for there was a deadly<WH4194> destruction<WH4103> throughout all the city<WH5892>; the hand<WH3027> of God<WH430> was very<WH3966> heavy there<WH3513>.
And the men<WH582> that died<WH4191> not were struck<WH5221> with the ulcers<WH2914>: and the cry<WH7775> of the city<WH5892> went up<WH5927> to heaven<WH8064>.
